name: Ghostly Undead
background:
The Ghostly Undead are incorporeal beings who venture into Tyria from the Empyrean Plane. Their armies are made up of lines of ghostly warriors wielding rusted weapons, supported by banshees and wraiths, driven forward by their ghostly jailers. 

These spectral creatures have been thrust from their blissful state of delusion by their Gods to harvest fresh souls. Tormented by the reality of what they have become, the Ghostly Undead lash out furiously at mortals, desperately trying to seize captives so that their Gods will allow them to return to their eternal delusion.
backgroundFull:
The Ghostly Undead enter Tyria from the Empyrean Plane, which some in Tyria believe to be the afterlife, ruled over by a pantheon of Death Gods. In truth, the gods of this plane draw their energy from the souls of those who live there, gradually draining their memories, thoughts, and personalities, until nothing remains but the shadowy husk of a soul. 

The gods of the Ghostly Undead each rule over their own part of the Empyrean Plane, where those trapped inside see the world around them as their god wills it: whether it’s a magnificent and heavenly kingdom, a warrior’s paradise, or a place of pain and torture. Those few mortals who have gone to these lands and escaped to tell the tale see something else entirely. They return with tales of shambling spirits lurking over desolate ruins, playing out mortal lives which have long been lost. Many of these spirits have completely forgotten their mortal lives, while others remember only scattered fragments. 

The Ghostly Undead are sometimes sent out to other planes by their gods, tasked with seeking out souls to bring back to the plane. These spirits only faintly understand their purpose; some believe they seek worthy souls to reward with paradise, others believe that they have come to bring down divine retribution on the foes of their gods. The Ghostly Undead only know for certain that they may solely return once they have taken enough souls to satisfy their masters. 

As the Ghostly Undead wander the outside of the Empyrean Plane, their gods’ glamors come undone, gradually causing them to become aware of their true appearance and surroundings. Many Ghostly Undead are horrified when confronted with their true nature, which drives them to a spiteful madness where they lose any sense of self and lash out furiously at any living creatures. Others become convinced that they have been trapped in an illusion, as a punishment for displeasing their god in some way, seeking desperately to redeem themselves so they may return to the Empyrean Plane.

 The Ghostly Undead have begun to pour into Tyria ever since the Rift opened many once-hidden Voidgates in Tyria. Once thought of as mere legend, it is now not uncommon to see large processions of Ghostly Undead prowling through the forgotten fringes of Tyria, seeking to claim those who have strayed too far from their homes. Sometimes they have also been known to bargain with mortals of Tyria who can offer them magic, souls, or a means of return to their home. 

How will you find your way through the mortal planes?

gains.name: Great Steed

sections.label: Upgrade up to three models with one

spells.name: Ethereal Warding
spells.effect: Pick one friendly unit within 12", which gets Empyrean Spirit Boost once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (params.aura ? this.AuraSize : 1), avgUnit: !params.thisUnit }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Dread Shriek
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 12", which takes 2 hits with AP(1) and Surge. Roll as many dice as hits to see if "on rolls of 6" effects trigger.

parameters.name: spellHitRoll
parameters.value: Roll as many dice as hits to see if "on rolls of 6" effects trigger.

spellHitRoll.name: Roll as many dice as hits to see if "on rolls of 6" effects trigger.

spells.effect: Pick up to two enemy units within 18", which friendly units gets Bane when attacking against once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Reaping Terror
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 12", which takes 4 hits with Reap.

spells.name: Eat Soul
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 18", which takes 6 hits.

specialRules.name: Sergeant
specialRules.description: When this model attacks, unmodified results of 6 to hit deal 1 extra hit (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Armor
specialRules.description: Counts as having Defense X+.

specialRules.name: Traversal
specialRules.description: May move through friendly and enemy units.

specialRules.name: Repel Ambushers
specialRules.description: Enemy units using Ambush must be set up over 12" away from this model's unit.

specialRules.name: No Retreat Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get No Retreat.

specialRules.name: Ethereal
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, place this model anywhere fully within 6" of its position. This model moves -6" when using Advance, and -6” when using Rush/Charge.

specialRules.name: Crossing Attack
specialRules.description: Once per activation, when this model moves through enemy units, pick one of them and roll X dice. For each 6+ it takes 1 hit.

specialRules.name: Empyrean Spirit
specialRules.description: When units where all models have this rule are shot or charged from over 9" away, enemy units get -1 to hit rolls.

specialRules.name: Empyrean Spirit Boost Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Empyrean Spirit Boost.

specialRules.name: Relentless Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Relentless.

specialRules.name: Scout Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Scout.

specialRules.name: Precision Feat Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Precision Feat.

specialRules.name: Unpredictable Fighter Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Unpredictable Fighter.

specialRules.name: Reap
specialRules.description: Against units where most models have Defense 2+ to Defense 3+, this weapon gets AP(+2).

specialRules.name: Shielded Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Shielded.

specialRules.name: Resistance
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule takes wounds, roll one die for each. On a 6+ it is ignored. If the wounds were from a spell, then they are ignored on a 2+ instead.

specialRules.name: Bane Mark
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick one enemy unit within 18", which friendly units gets Bane when attacking against once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Defense
specialRules.description: This model gets +X to defense rolls.

specialRules.name: Ambush
specialRules.description: May be set aside before deployment. At the start of any round after the first, may be deployed anywhere over 9” away from enemy units. Players alternate in placing Ambush units, starting with the player that activates next. Units that deploy via Ambush can’t seize or contest objectives on the round they deploy.

specialRules.name: No Retreat
specialRules.description: When a unit where most models have this rule fails a morale test that causes it to be Shaken or Routed, the test counts as passed instead. Then, roll as many dice as the number of wounds it would take to fully destroy it, and for each result of 1-3 the unit takes one wound, which can't be ignored.

specialRules.name: Empyrean Spirit Boost
specialRules.description: If all models in this unit have Empyrean Spirit, enemies attacking them always get -1 to hit rolls from Empyrean Spirit (instead of only when being shot/charged from over 9" away).

specialRules.name: Relentless
specialRules.description: When this model shoots at enemies over 9" away, unmodified results of 6 to hit deal 1 extra hit (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Scout
specialRules.description: May be set aside before deployment. After all other units are deployed, may be deployed anywhere fully within 12” of their deployment zone. Players alternate in placing Scout units, starting with the player that activates next.

specialRules.name: Precision Feat
specialRules.description: Once per game, when this unit attacks and all its models have this rule, you may use this rule so that they get +2 to hit rolls.

specialRules.name: Unpredictable Fighter
specialRules.description: When in melee, roll one die and apply one effect to all models with this rule: on a 1-3 they get AP(+1), and on a 4-6 they get +1 to hit rolls instead.

specialRules.name: Unpredictable
specialRules.description: When attacking, roll one die and apply one effect to all models with this rule: on a 1-3 they get AP(+1), and on a 4-6 they get +1 to hit rolls instead.

specialRules.name: AP
specialRules.description: Targets get -X to Defense rolls when blocking hits.

specialRules.name: Shielded
specialRules.description: Units where all models have this rule get +1 to defense rolls against hits that are not from spells.

specialRules.name: Bane
specialRules.description: Ignores Regeneration, and when attacking the target must re-roll unmodified Defense results of 6.

specialRules.name: Surge
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 6 to hit, this weapon deals 1 extra hits (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).
